doc:
Richard Quine https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Richard_Quine 0 Richard Quine (November 12, 1920 – June 10, 1989) was an American stage, film, and radio actor and, later, a film director. He began acting as a child in radio, vaudeville, and stage productions before being signed to Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer in his early twenties. When his acting career began to wane after World War II, Quine began working as a film director. He later moved into producing and directing television. Quine directed several well-known films, including Bell Book and Candle (1958), The World of Suzie Wong (1960), Paris When It Sizzles (1964), How to Murder Your Wife (1965), and The Prisoner of Zenda (1979). Depressed over poor health, Quine died of a self-inflicted gunshot wound in June 1989 at the age of 68. Richard_Quine ( November_12_,_1920 – June_10_,_1989 ) was an_American_stage , film , and radio_actor and , later , a_film_director . He began_acting as a_child in radio , vaudeville , and stage_productions before being_signed to Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer in his_early_twenties . When his_acting_career began_to_wane after World_War_II , Quine began_working as a_film_director . He later moved into producing_and_directing_television . Quine directed several_well-known_films , including Bell_Book and Candle_(_1958_) , The_World of Suzie_Wong_(_1960_) , Paris When It Sizzles (_1964_) , How to Murder Your_Wife_(_1965_) , and The_Prisoner of Zenda_(_1979_) . Depressed over poor_health , Quine died of a_self-inflicted_gunshot_wound in June_1989 at the_age of 68 .
